intro: Spigelia multispica, commonly known as the purpleroot or redroot, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its reddish-brown tuberous roots and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial shade. Its flowers, which are usually pink to purple in color, bloom in late spring to early summer. Spigelia multispica is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
